greenmirror.fxwrappers

Class CircleFxWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • greenmirror.FxWrapper
        • greenmirror.FxShapeWrapper
          • greenmirror.fxwrappers.CircleFxWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class CircleFxWrapper
extends FxShapeWrapper
    The FxWrapper for circle FX nodes.
    Author:
    Karim El Assal

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CircleFxWrapper.CenterXTransition
      A Transition class that animates the centerX value of a Circle.

      A Transition class that animates the centerY value of a Circle.
      static class  CircleFxWrapper.RadiusTransition
      A Transition class that animates the change of the radius.

    • Method Detail

      • getAnimatableProperties

        protected @NonNull List<FxPropertyWrapper> getAnimatableProperties()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Returns the JavaFX node's properties that can be animated (and thus: can be changed during a transition). All animatable properties also are changable properties. These differ per subclass, but always contain the ones defined by FxWrapper. Overriding subclasses should also execute this method.
        Overrides:
        getAnimatableProperties in class FxShapeWrapper
        Returns:
        the properties that can be animated
        See Also:
        FxWrapper.getChangableProperties(), FxPropertyWrapper

      • getChangableProperties

        protected @NonNull List<FxPropertyWrapper> getChangableProperties()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Returns the properties of the JavaFX node that can be changed using this FxWrapper. That they can be changed does not mean they can be animated. If a property is only changable, but not animatable, it can only be set once.
        Overrides:
        getChangableProperties in class FxShapeWrapper
        Returns:
        the properties that can be changed by using this FxWrapper

      • getFxNode

        public Circle getFxNode()
        Overrides:
        getFxNode in class FxShapeWrapper
        Returns:
        the JavaFX node that this FxWrapper was created for

      • getCenterY

        public Double getCenterY()
        Returns:
        the virtual centerY value of the FX node

      • getX

        public Double getX()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Returns the x coordinate of the virtual origin of the FX node. Warning: the origin might differ per subclass of FxWrapper (for example: circles have their origin in their center, while rectangles have their origin in their top left corner).

        This method is only added for compatibility reasons.

        Specified by:
        getX in class FxWrapper
        Returns:
        the x coordinate of the origin

      • getY

        public Double getY()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Returns the y coordinate of the virtual origin of the FX node. Warning: the origin might differ per subclass of FxWrapper (for example: circles have their origin in their center, while rectangles have their origin in their top left corner).

        This method is only added for compatibility reasons.

        Specified by:
        getY in class FxWrapper
        Returns:
        the y coordinate of the origin

      • calculatePoint

        public @NonNull Point3D calculatePoint(@NonNull Placement placement)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Calculates the absolute point with of a specified Placement on the JavaFX node. E.g.: if this is a RectangleFxWrapper representing a 100x100 rectangle at position (10,10) of the canvas, calculatePoint(Placement.MIDDLE) would result in point (60,60).
        Specified by:
        calculatePoint in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        placement - the position of placement which should be calculated.
        Returns:
        the absolute point

                                                @NonNull Duration duration)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the change

      • calculateOriginCoordinates

        protected @NonNull Point3D calculateOriginCoordinates(@NonNull Point3D middlePoint)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Calculates the coordinates of the FX node's origin when its middle point is equal to nodeMiddlePoint. These coordinates can differ per type of node.

        For example: rectangles have their origin coordinates in their upper left corner. This method would use the following calculation to calculate the x coordinate: double coordinateX = nodeMiddlePoint.getX() - getWidth() / 2; Similarly, an FxWrapper wrapping a circle node would return the same values as nodeMiddlePoint.

        Specified by:
        calculateOriginCoordinates in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        middlePoint - the middle point of the FX node
        Returns:
        the origin coordinates of the FX node

      • setToPositionWithMiddlePoint

        public void setToPositionWithMiddlePoint(@NonNull Point3D middlePoint)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Sets the virtual positioning property values to the point where its middle point is equal to nodesNewMiddlePoint.
        Specified by:
        setToPositionWithMiddlePoint in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        middlePoint - the new middle point indicating the positioning values of this wrapper

      • setFxToPositionWithMiddlePoint

        public void setFxToPositionWithMiddlePoint(@NonNull Point3D middlePoint)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Sets the JavaFX node positioning property values to the point where its middle point is equal to nodesNewMiddlePoint.
        Specified by:
        setFxToPositionWithMiddlePoint in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        middlePoint - the new middle point of the FX node
